revised_title: Effects of Mechanical Stress on Electrical Resistance of Metals
tldr: This study investigates the effects of mechanical stress on the electrical resistance of metals, specifically copper, iron, and steel wires. The authors found that stretching the wires caused a temporary alteration in specific resistance, but no permanent changes unless there was permanent stretching. The results suggest that mechanical treatment does not significantly affect the electrical properties of the tested metals, unlike the impact of impurities.
